Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; GROUND; PAINTED
Name: Cup
Description: Cup made from a coarse clay containing large quantities of organic temper. The base is flat and cut on the wheel, the body is concave and the lip is flared and convex. The latter is decorated with a painted white circle. A few spots decorate the inside. This vessel was part of a set placed at the entrance of one of the chambers of a multiple burial.
